page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: William Penney Brookes (1809-1895), a local man was, for over half a century the community's local doctor, greatly respected & justly famous for his unlimited energy in promoting numerous civic improvement schemes.His concern was to raise the quality of life for local people: he started the Agricultural Reading Society out of which grew the Wenlock Olympian Society with its annual Games a blend of country sports,athletics & cultural activities. From his efforts was built the Corn Exchange & Reading Rooms; gas & piped water were installed and the railway was brought to Much Wenlock. His belief in sport as a civilising influence & admiration for classical Greece led him to campaign inter - nationally for a modern Olympics. He died just prior 1st.modern Olympiad.
